name: Thursday Night Folk Gems with Anthea Feaver
description: Anthea Feaver is a songwriter passionate about traditional folk music, a teacher with a degree in community arts education, and an old-time fiddle and banjo player. Whether at an intimate house concert or on a festival stage, she draws people together and has them singing along. Her first full-length album "Summer's Morning" (released September 2024) is "a broad and luxurious array of folk-inspired gems" driven by lush string arrangements, poignant lyricism, and Anthea's deft fingerpicking (Lock Magazine). An emerging voice in the folk community, "Anthea Feaver is one to watch" (Americana UK).

name: A Clay Sculpting Workshop
description:
Treat yourself to the therapeutic experience of sculpting at Artbox Studio Gallery. Learn how to create a piece of sculpture art unique to you. No experience needed.

Please see more Sculpting Workshops here: https://www.artboxstudiogallery.com/sculpting

name: A Mixed Media Workshop: Nature Through the Window
description: Design your own "window view" into nature using an exciting mix of materials like fabrics, yarn, foils, and more. In this mixed media workshop, you'll create a textured, layered artwork inspired by sunsets, forests, or any natural scene you love. A vibrant & relaxing experience for all skill levels.

name: Presence: Roma XLV
description: An annual showcase of Architecture student work produced during the Rome Program. The University of Waterloo School of Architecture is proud to reaffirm our long-standing Presence in the city of Rome with an exhibit of our design projects, sketches, photographs and videos. The material, serving as both a commentary and a criticism of the Italian built landscape, conveys the lasting impact of our 3-month stay in Rome during a pivotal moment in our degree. Since 1979, the Rome Program has been an integral part of the bachelor's degree at UWSA, exposing students to a new approach to architecture and architectural pedagogy. We are delighted to invite you to celebrate the 45th year of a continued legacy.

organizer.name: Student Exhibition Team  in association with the University of Waterloo School of Architecture

name: Composers In Play XVI: Sounding the Queer Canon
description: Piano Lunaire invites you to reconsider identities of Queer artists in contemporary classical music and reflect on the nature of the Queer Musical Canon, such as it is; such as it might be. Bringing together the exceptional talents of mezzo-soprano Claire McCahan, baritone Nathaniel Sullivan and pianist/composer Adam Sherkin in a myriad song programme asking the big questions about a North American queer experience. Composer Michael Genese joins in person for the Canadian premiere of their poignant and urgent, "The Boy with Baleen for Teeth" for mezzo, baritone and piano.

name: Wednesday Late Night Singer-Songwriter Folk Set with Les Armstrong
description: Les Armstrong is a singer-songwriter from Toronto with a firm foundation in roots, traditional folk music, and rock 'n roll. She has a head full of evocative melodies, and she sings about city problems, like homelessness, gentrification, and loneliness. People often say she has a '60s/'70s sound thanks to her classic arrangements and spunky vocals.

name: Thriller/Suspense Festival
description:
Showcasing the best thriller/suspense short films from the last year from around the world today.

See the full lineup of films on event website.

name: Not Safe For Work
description: A brand-new comedy show clocking in to roast the unrelenting day-to-day grind. From incompetent managers and weird co-workers to impossible customers and inboxes that are like an all-you-can-eat buffet of stupidity, no job is safe. Whether you're hustling in the gig economy, surviving the 9-to-5, or just trying to make it through one more Zoom call without consuming a vat of medical-grade caffeine, The Second City's cast of comedic professionals are here working overtime with their world-famous brand of sketch and improv comedy. Don't call in sick… you'll want to be here for this shift.

name: New Tricks

location.name: The Citadel: Ross Centre for Dance

description: An intimate work that uses costume, disguise, ritual and 44 years of choreographic research to explore new potentialities in a veteran body. Personal and playful, it highlights the ambiguity of gesture, the poetry of inefficiency, and a queering of the imagination and the flesh.
image: https://secure.toronto.ca/webapps/CC/fileAPI/edc_eventcal/Laurence Selects Christopher B&W by O¿mer Yu¿kseker (1) (1)_OhOVRp_bVsmacSgjWr8YIQ.jpg

name: Venus In Fur
description:
Venus In Fur is a one act casting couch comedy about gendered power dynamics with a satisfying dose of kink. With a creative team that includes queer artists who are active and working in the Toronto BDSM and kink scene, this production brings a unique, respectful, and honest perspective as it pertains to Domination and Submission as a healing modality.

In Venus In Fur, a beleaguered, controlling playwright and first-time director is desperate to find the lead for his adaptation of the classic 1870 sadomasochistic tale by Leopold von Sacher-Masoch. Into his empty audition room storms an equally desperate actress—with connections to the material that seem to be too coincidental to be true.

name: Standup Comedy Special Only About Dating
description: From dating apps, love algorithms to podcast bros and reality shows like Love Is Blind, comedian Dan Pan takes you on a hilarious deep dive into modern romance in a world run by swipes, screens, and toxic advice.
